column1: reallocates new memory which is exactly one pointer bigger than before
Arrlist objects stores number of elements as size -> new size = (num of elems + 1) * pointer size
Arrlist also stores pointers to the starts of the strings and realloc transfers those pointers to new location called temp
// if reallocation fails end this function

column2: // elements are now in new place created by realloc
// creates new space in memory to store input string
// copies given string into newly created memory space
// first adress of newly created memory space is added to array of pointers == adding string to list
// list has one element more now

column1: // move all elements one to the left starting at the index
//create new element list in memory and remove old one
